com.fasterxml.storemate.store.file

Class FileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fasterxml.storemate.store.file.FileManager

  • public class FileManager
extends Object
    Handler class that takes care of mapping external logical path into physical path to use for storing large content BLOBs (that is, content that is NOT inlined in database).

    Some things worth noting on mapping:

    • We will be creating files sequentially on directories, to keep size of each directory manageable (typically something like 1000 or so)
    • All directory and file names are in ASCII
    • We can try optimizing file names for BDB prefix elimination: as a result, things that differ (sequence id) should be added as suffixes
    • For convenience, a little bit of metadata is retained in filenames, such as compression type (last suffix)

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected File _activeBranch
      Child directory under _dateBranch where files are actively being written.
      protected int _activeBranchId
      Numeric part of the active branch, used for roll over.
      protected File _dataRoot
      Root directory under which data directories are dynamically created.
      protected String _dataRootPath
      And we also need to sometimes prepend data root as String
      protected File _dateBranch
      Directory (under _dataRoot) that is currently used as the active branch, and is named based on time when it was created.
      protected int _fileIndex
      Per-directory running file number; used for ensuring that we don't fill directories too full
      protected FilenameConverter _filenameConverter 
      protected int _maxFilenameBaseLength 
      protected int _maxFilesPerDir
      How many files will we store in individual directories?
      protected long _nextDateCheck
      Timestamp of time when we should advance to a new _dateBranch
      protected String _relativeActivePath
      String to use as the prefix when storing path relative to storage root.
      protected TimeMaster _timeMaster
